intro: Cayaponia pedata var. latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved cayaponia, is a species native to Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its habitat typically includes moist, tropical forests, where it thrives in partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
